Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rick y
Reviews.Content: stayed here during I.B.C. week on Beale St.Very nice,quiet, clean.Staff most friendly and helpful.Trolley to downtown block away,or if your up to it can walk,only 2 miles.Excellant breakfast.Will definetly stay again,next time in Memphis

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room,402.”
Reviews.Author: rmt2480
Reviews.Content: Excellent new place.good value. Good meal at Cafe Fuel. Seems convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Capps”
Reviews.Author: roney c
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. The breakfast was good. Although not in the most scenic part of town it is a great value for the money. We felt safe and secure. It is close downtown without the high prices, and it is also close to the hospitals which was the reason for our stay. We checked out a few of the other hotels in the area before we booked a room and this was the best price. We also mentioned that we had a family member in the hospital nearby and they gave us a discount. We needed to stay an additional night so we called the hotel from the hospital they took care of it no problem. Also this nights stay was at the discounted price. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from cleanliness and comfort, we were greeted and assisted with only smiles.”
Reviews.Author: Epurcell203
Reviews.Content: The GenX hotel has great service, great breakfast and great housekeeping staff. Although far walking distance from Beale st and downtown, taxis are cheap. Go with Arrow Cab. Feels like home no matter where you are traveling from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: Anna B
Reviews.Content: We were a little skeptical of this hotel after seeing the area but we were pleasantly surprised. The lot and hotel were plenty safe (we left our car in the lot during the day and took the trolley and never had a problem). The hotel has been renovated nicely and the room was comfortable and tidy. The hotel staff was very friendly and gave good recommendations about what to do in Memphis. The trolley station is a 2 block walk (the area does look a little iffy, but we never had a problem) and it goes directly downtown to the mall and Beale street. The only downside was the trolley does go down the street in front of the hotel and it can be a little noisy every 16 minutes but after awhile you start to tune it out. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: l b
Reviews.Content: I pulled into this great little in town gem after driving 500 miles. It was clean and quiet. My room was spacious and well appointed. Although the hotel is located in the medical/university area, it is a short trolley ride to downtown and Beale Street. Equally convenient 10 minute drive to graceland. Free breakfast is much appreciated as there are no restaurants walkable....eat before you come.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Deneen C
Reviews.Content: Whe I arrived I had a terrible headache and the staff hurried my registration so that I could get to my room and relax. The room was comfortable and I had the best nights sleep I had all week. The morning staff was super friendly. This was a great experience and I will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared to stay here, pleanty safe!”
Reviews.Author: AdeTae
Reviews.Content: This passed my test. I have no idea what 'crack house' the people on here were talking about. But I will say in or outside of any city, you have to take precautions and not leave temptations laying around your car that make people want to smash and grab. The whole parking lot had a huge iron gate around it. The hotel was in the medical area. There was a Holiday Inn Express just behind the hotel, which again tells me the area wasn't so bad. If you've never been to a big city I can relate to hesitations, just be aware of your self and surroundings. We even jumped in the trolly a few blocks down and took it to Beal. The room hotel and room passed my personal test of white linens. Everything was clean. The staff was real nice and helped us with our hesitations by recomending a cab back if after 11pm. I'm sure if you walk around the hotel with a magnifying glass you'll find something you don't like anywhere you go. Nothing seemed gross, sketchy or dingy. I wish there was some way i could ebb fears from here. I was seriously worried about it after the reviews i read and had already paid on priceline. My husband was REAL worried too. But this hotel is just fine! The free breakfast was decent. I WOULD recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, on trolley line”
Reviews.Author: Nicole W
Reviews.Content: We found this online after spending the previous night a few km further out from Beale street. It was a clean, comfortable room and just what we required. It was a bit of a walk to the Trolley line, but we were comfortable walking there during the day. The taxi ride back from Beale street was quick and convenient. We found out a day after we left that we'd misplaced something in our room, and they were so kind as to keep it until we could go back and pick it up. Excellent service, and we will most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Mid-Town Memphis”
Reviews.Author: DLyles
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Gen-X Inn while attending an event at my son's college. I have tried other hotels in the mid-town area and I will be returning to the Gen-X. The hotel is located near several colleges in Mid-Town, yet is a trolley ride away from the downtown area. The lobby and our room were very clean and comfortable and the staff was very helpful. Our room was quiet and well appointed for the price. The staff was very attentive, greeting us each time we entered or exited the hotel, and responded quickly to requests. Over all we had a very positive experience and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: arhogfan
Reviews.Content: Other than the Holiday Inn, I had been unable to locate a hotel in mid-town Mempho. When Holiday Inn could not accommodate me, they referred me to the Best Western Plus Gen X, which is located immediately north of the Holiday Inn on Madison. I had not found this hotel on previous searches and did not expect much, but I was very pleasantly surprised. For a walk-in price of $99 (plus $20 in taxes), I got a fresh, clean, attractive room that was larger than expected. There were many upscale touches (big showerhead, fluffy towels, nice wall paper) and the staff was friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is the pits, but we walked about a half mile to Minglewood Hall for a concert and returned on foot after midnight without incident or threat, but I kept my eyes open while we walked. The parking lot is fenced and covered by security cameras. The trolley runs right down Madison past the hotel to downtown, but doesn't go far east past the hotel. I think this hotel is as safe and $50-$75 cheaper than what you can find downtown. I found the new looking wood floors in the hallway very attractive, but they may not muffle noise as well as carpet. We did have Wi-Fi while we were there and there was a decent breakfast bar in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “One of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Triphelp69
Reviews.Content: Recently, over the Labor Day Weekend of 2011, I stayed at the Best Western Gen-X Hotel in Memphis, Tn. I had never stayed there before so I was just going by the reviews that I had seen on Tripadvisor. I seen that there were mixed reviews so I deceided to stay there based on the cost of the room and the close proximity to the downtown area. Upon check-in, the young lady at the front desk informed me at 10:00 a.m. that the room was not ready. My flight had got into memphis early a.m. so I was hoping that a room was available. When I asked if the hotel was completely sold out (6 cars total in the entire parking lot, and one of them was mine) she unkindly said yes, which was hard, if not impossible, to believe. I asked if there was any one else I could speak to and she called the shift manager. I spoke to her and she kindly said that she would get me a room immediately, which she did. (duh?) What's up with that, "unfriendly girl at the front desk"? Nice intoduction! Yeah you, the one with no personality. At any rate, after the rocky start, I found my room that was unbelieveably clean and quiet at night. No noise which means a lot to travelers, especially me. I stayed there for 3 nights over Labor Day weekend. No problems at all, except for that small hiccup on the first day. The other staff members, except for Miss Congeniality on the 1st day at the front desk, were very helpful. There was a small fitness center with a treadmill, etc and a business center with one computer. The breakfast is nothing to write home about. Waffle maker, yogurt, bread for toast, bulk cereal, watered-down undrinkable orange juice, etc. Very, very basic. They could do better in the breakfast department. But then again, I didn't stay there because of the breakfast so this was just information for future guests. Overall, I would rate this hotel a 6 out of ten. I'm just glad that the other employees at the hotel weren't nearly as unpleasant and uncaring as the 1st one I encountered at the front desk. Recommend for close proximity to town. Not as bad of an area location as a previous reviewers portrayed. Recommend for quiet. Not recommended for breakfast. Go somewhere else. And last recommendation to Hotel Gen-X. Please consider sending front desk girl to customer relation class. Nobody want's to be greeted like that. Thank you. I recommend Gen-X.

Reviews.Title: “Great place except for internet service”
Reviews.Author: Dbram
Reviews.Content: We misread the internet ad and thought it was WiFi in the room, but it was not. Could only use internet in the lobby and that is not the point of bringing out laptops on trips. We look up best routes, resturants and entertainment before we leave in vehicles and don't wish to discuss this in a lobby. Other than that the room, bed and showers were all very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmfinn
Reviews.Content: Staff OK. Breakfast is below anyone's expectations. When you have to get buzzed in to a hotel and you can not find a restaurant (not fast food) with in 2 miles you know you are not in the best of neighborhoods. No internet, no gym, no nothing

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Leave valuables in your car!”
Reviews.Author: MBHMarietta_GA
Reviews.Content: My son stayed in his hotel last night. This morning he awoke to find that his vehicle had been broken into along with several other cars. His vehicle was parked in visibility of the front desk of the hotel. He was not advised upon check in that there had been recent thefts in the parking lot. He had several thousand dollars of camera equipment and electronics stolen. Had he been told about recent break ins he would have stayed elsewhere. The hotel did not charge him for his room however our insurance deductables for replacing his window and the stolen items are going to be huge. We are waiting to see how the hotel management responds to us and will post again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: AMJ12345
Reviews.Content: It was July 1st, 2011 when my cousin called me from the Best Western Hotel located on 1177 Madison Ave. in Memphis, Tennessee. We both had made reservations to stay at the hotel with our family during the 4th of July holiday weekend. I had made reservations for three rooms for a three night stay. My cousin proceeded to tell me that the desk clerk at the Best Western was very unfriendly, the sofas in the lounge were dirty, the hotel smelled like mildew and paint, the hotel was located in an unsafe area and she was hesitant about staying one night in the place. She further stated that the desk clerk refused to cancel our reservations because of their 24 hour cancellation policy. Neither one of us were informed about their policy when we made our reservations. After we finished our conversation, I immediately called Best Westernâ€™s customer service line to plead our case, but again our request was denied. Eventually my cousin decided to call one of our uncles to pick her up until I arrived in town. When I arrived at the hotel my family and I checked in because at that point we had no choice. I still had three rooms reserved on my credit card at $119 per night and I didnâ€™t relish the idea of paying over $600 for rooms we didnâ€™t even stay in. A couple hours later my mom, my brother and my nephews arrived at the hotel and they also refused to stay at the hotel because they were concerned about the location and the cleanest of the hotel. Instead they checked in at the Holiday Inn located on 3700 Central Ave., in Memphis for the same rate I was paying at the Best Western, so my husband and I agreed to join them with our kids the following morning. At the Best Western, the carpet in our room was dirty, one of the walls had stains on them, the wall paper around the window was peeling, the furniture in the room was extremely dusty and my daughter discovered black foot prints in the bathtub, so much for southern hospitality. This hotel was truly a dumpster dive. My cousin and I were both deceived by the pictures of the hotel on the internet. When I woke up the next morning I immediately went downstairs to check on my car while my family slept. To my horror, the front passenger window had been broken out and glass was everywhere. Then I noticed that van that was parked next to my car also had a broken window. This should have never happened because both cars were parked in a well lit area and close to the building. Furthermore, the parking lot was small, both vehicles were parked in the direct view of the security cameras, and a night attendant was on duty. I checked my car to see if anything was taken. A few items were stolen from both vehicles, but nothing that couldnâ€™t be easily replaced (i.e., dvds, tapes,). When I reported the incidents to the night clerk, she claimed she was unaware of what had transpired that night. Someone please tell me what was the purpose of the hotel security cameras? Later on I found out that a third car had been broken into and possibly more vehicles. This particular vehicle was sitting in the parking lot less than 50 ft. away from the front office and once again it was in a well lit area. So, when I asked the night clerk had she notify the other guests concerning their vehicles, the night attendant stated she didnâ€™t know which guests owned the vehicles. Imagine their surprise when they eventually saw their cars. I found it quite odd that the hotel didnâ€™t record the car tag and driverâ€™s license number of their guests when they checked into the hotel. Maybe I am wrong, but I thought this was a standard practice at most hotels and motels around the U.S. today especially during this post 911 era at least it use to be. When I spoke to the manager that morning, she didnâ€™t seem at all surprised about what had happened to my car nor did she seem to care about my familyâ€™s current predicament. In fact, she was very cold and totally removed from the entire situation. However, she did agree to refund me for one of the roomâ€™s on my credit card. So while my husband was cleaning out the glass of our rental car (â€œThank GOD we have GEICO insurance!â€�) I gave the staff at the hotel a â€œHUGE!â€� piece of my mind and I proceeded to tell every guest at the hotel about our â€œWONDERFUL!â€� stay at the Best Western. Fortunately, I was able persuade several customers (10+) from staying at that hotel. At the end, I felt slightly vindicated even though I lost all of my cool points for the day. Later my husband told me that the people who worked in the building behind the hotel informed him that our incident was not uncommon at this hotel. In fact, guests were often robbed at this hotel. Furthermore, the building that was located on the right rear side of the hotel was a crack house. I donâ€™t know how true this latter statement was, but I wouldnâ€™t be surprise. The building did look suspicious. On another note, the company that I had rented our car from was Budget Car Rental. When I called the company to report the incident they were very friendly and understanding. We were able to trade the Nissan Sentra in for a Jeep Compass without any additional charges. The SUV had excellent gas mileage for a vehicle of its size. So after our ordeal we checked in at the Holiday Inn where the rest of my family was staying. The rooms were extremely clean, the hotel was in a safe area and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Best Western should really take a lesson from Holiday Inn. Later that evening, I called customer service at Best Westernâ€™s headquarters to report the entire incident. They finally removed all of the charges off my credit card, but not from my cousinâ€™s credit card. This really didnâ€™t make any sense to me because everyone that I told our story to at the hotel canceled their reservations and the charges were immediately removed from their credit cards even without a 24 hour notice, this is definitely double standards. Customer service at Best Western further stated that the hotel in Memphis would be given 7 days to correct all of complaints that we filed against them. Will they improve the quality of services they provide their customers at this location? Who knows, but one thing I do know for sure is that my family will never, ever, ever stay in the Best Western on Madison Avenue in Memphis, Tennessee again. â€œHats off to Holiday Inn!â€�

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst BW, we have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: krzyvern
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel. First off we booked on line, when we got there they did not charge us the online discount, instead we ended up paying a $123.00 for one night at this little crappy hotel. You ask why? Everything else was booked up, we had already made the drive up there. The lady at the front desk was the same one that we had talked to over the phone before we finalized our reservations online, and she was rude and very unprofessional. Every time we came downstairs there was not anybody behind the desk, instead they were on the lobby couch playing with computer or phone. Now to the room, as soon as we walked in there were two huge nasty looking stains on the floor, the bathroom was dirty. As for the breakfast, it was a disappointment to, they did not have anything to drink other than coffee even though water is advertised. For the price this is far from what I expected and we will never stay here again. We were suppose to stay two nights but we left and went to the Best Western in Horn Lake which was $44.00 cheaper and wonderful service and clean rooms. It is only a 10 minute drive from Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LaynaArkansas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of times, just for an overnight trip to Memphis to go out partying. I came in late, and the desk clerk after midnight was rude, but the rest of the staff was over the top nice, so I forgive them for the late night guy. The room was great, beds extremely comfortable, a nice offering of food in the morning with the free breakfast, just the basics. I didn't eat much there. It was nice to have a bite and talk to the front desk lady, who was awesome. It's close to Beal St., and you can get a cheap taxi there and back easily.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: tnmarky
Reviews.Content: This is a basic motel that is a good value if location is your priority. There were some minor problems with maintenance in my room, the most important of which was a broken lock (the swing away security type - the main locks worked). The end table was damaged, there were slight stains on the blanket, and the toilet bowl (underneath the seat) had not been cleaned well upon check in. This motel is part of the trend to mimic boutique hotels in a sort of superficial way, but in reality is just a decent motel with a reasonable but limited breakfast and good service staff. It is near to hospitals which I would guess is its main selling point.

Reviews.Title: “The Gen X Inn is perfect for trips to visit my son at Rhodes College”
Reviews.Author: lbjje
Reviews.Content: We spend time in both downtown and mid-town town so the location is great. We do not spend much time in the room but the level of cleanliness and comfort is still very nice. The personal are professional and pleasant. My family and I have stayed at this location many times over the past two years and have always been happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “HOW DISHONEST”
Reviews.Author: Bornatraveller
Reviews.Content: We drove into Memphis very late at night whilst on a two week roadtrip. Checked in, which was pleasant, but then our nightmare started the luggage cart had a flat tire and couldn't maneuver very easlier, the room was fairly descent, although carpets had horrible stains on, the coffee machine did not work and the window rattled the whole night, we didn't want to wake up our daughter to move rooms so we tried our best to get some shut eye as we were only there for one day and had loads to see and visit the next day, THIS DID NOT HAPPEN, upon bringing it up to Jennifer, the manager the next day she proceeded to tell us that the luggage cart tire was not flat, the coffee machine did work and the window did not rattle, wow what huge imaginations we must have, she did however move us to a different room and did promise us a 30% refund for the night, which up to date we haven't got. P.S. the breakfast is a poor excuse for an attempt at offereing a "FREE" breakfast. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location and very lacking in amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Donna33997
Reviews.Content: It was impossible to obtain a bottle of water, no vending machine and staff had no water when asked - twice. Location too far out of town unless you have a rental car. Staff only provided one small bar of soap and one wash cloth for two guests. Also the continental breakfast was extremely sparse - not many choices. We have stayed at Best Western's frequently, and this breakfast wasn't adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find in a rundown town”
Reviews.Author: 1lsilver
Reviews.Content: Memphis isn't what one would call updated. Frankly just driving around it really looks like a poor city. Too bad too because the people are friendly and welcoming. The Gen X is a relatively newly renovated hotel and it is well maintained. The staff was generally accommodating - there is very little offered at the place aside from breakfast cereal too early in the morning. Still, in a town full of great restaurants, that wasn't a problem. We were very happy with the location - just a stone's throw from Beale, The Lorraine, Sun Records, and not that far from the ballfield, Stax or Graceland and Cockadoos for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “nice motel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Gr_Berlin
Reviews.Content: location not that good, but did not feel unsafe, quick access to Graceland

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ktdtw3
Reviews.Content: Went to Memphis for Gonerfest and this hotel was on a list of good hotels to stay at. I have to say that they were right. Seems to have been recently updated....rooms very clean with new flat screen tvs. Bathrooms very clean! ( major points for me )! Staff was friendly. Located next to an animal hospital in an industrial area but really just min by car to most attractions. I would def stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cejackson
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in late July, found the hotel on Expedia and chose it for its rate and proximity to downtown Memphis. Found the hotel very clean and new looking. The room was very nice, small bathroom, good tv and dvd, was all around comfortable and we were pleased. Did not make it down to the continental breakfast, but had good in-room coffee. Unlike some other reviewers I found the place and the parking felt very safe. There was an iron fence around the whole of the parking lot, and did not seem like a run down neighborhood to me. Very easy access to downtown Memphis and very easy to get in and out. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know a Best Western could be so nice!”
Reviews.Author: junemoonchild63
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying here. The room was quite lovely....flat screen tv, dvd player and the bed reminded me of the nice beds at Hyatt chains. It had a very upscale feel to the room. The bathroom was very nice also. The price was great....great bargain. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And I loved that the hotel was right off of I40...made it very easy to find. Will definitely stay at this hotel again when in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Foxpup82
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed one night at the Gen X Memphis. We were greeted and checked in quickly by the friendly desk attendant. Although there were only two elevators, there was never a wait during our stay. The rooms were great! Very spacious, new flat screen tv, all modern furnishings and the beds seemed new. The sheets were 100% thick cotton (this is important to me!) and the rest of the bed linens were natural fiber as well, no unpleasant polyester here! The beds were very comfortable, with fluffy nice pillows. Both the room and the bathroom were spotless. I consider myself to be an expert in this area, as I used to work as a housekeeper at a hotel myself. I even checked the baseboards behind the beds - not a speck of dust! The housekeeping crew here is great. The bathroom was modern as well, with a huge showerhead, and the hot water came on right away with no wait. The towels were fresh and fluffy, seemed new as well. True, the neighborhood is pretty average - if you are on foot, you probably won't want to stay here - we didn't think it was much different from the other main streets in terms of crime etc, but there's not a lot around in the way of restaurants and such. If you have a rental car (recommended in Memphis anyway), no problem at all. Just a 5 minute drive down Madison Ave and there's drug stores, restuarants and more. The free breakfast was very satisfactory - they even have a waffle maker!!! I had a great waffle with maple syrup and some bottled juice while I read the paper in the cute and stylish dining area. The staff was great - friendly and helpful. My only criticism of the Gen X is they didn't have a box of tissues in the room - I wouldn't normally notice this, but I had a hayfever attack that day - springtime down south... We will defijnitely stay here again, I thought it was 4-star quality, and am recommending it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Miamigirl48
Reviews.Content: Purpose of our trip was Beale Street, and we stayed at Gen X for three days, Extremely clean, pleasant and helpful staff, attractive rooms. We had no trouble getting downtown--we rode the trolley, took cabs (there were four of us) and drove--no problems. Would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great (and apologetic) staff, just bad timing”
Reviews.Author: kkua
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a stormy night... needless to say, about 3 hrs after check-in, the entire hotel had a power surge and only emergency lights came on. The alarm clock was reset (didn't realize until morning after) and I am thankful the backup wake up call. The staff was very apologetic about the power outage and got it restored before midnight. This property will be converted to a franchise (most likely Best Western) before the end of the first half of 2009. You will need your own set of wheels especially if you have limited time. I was on a 14hr overnight layover. The public transport is not abundant in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neko1096
Reviews.Content: The Gen X is a nice and clean Hotel. It is located close to Beale St but not walking distance. The trolley is nearby but we resorted to taking cabs back and forth. Beds are comfortable, showers are good, and a great plasma tv. They had a small refrigerator in the room which was nice. No wireless internet except in the lobby but there are outlets in the room to plug directly into so take a ethernet cable. No security problems as posted in other reviews. Front desk was as helpful when asked for directions. I would stay here again. On the other hand, we had just checked out of the Springs motel in Hot Springs, so this was like the Ritz Carlton to us!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price and the location”
Reviews.Author: mpickard9
Reviews.Content: We were recently in town for the Liberty Bowl. We chose this hotel because of its price and location to the trolley line. The trolley stopped 2 blockes in either direction of the hotel, so it was an easy walk, and I didn't feel like I was in an area that wasn't safe. The rooms were spacious, we had three men in one room, with 2 double beds and a blow up mattress we brought, and there was still plenty of room for us to move. The room looked and smelled clean, and the staff behind the counter were very polite and helpful. When I had a question about the trolley the man at the desk looked up the schedule on his laptop, and let use his laptop. If we are selected for the Liberty Bowl next year, I won't even look at travel sites, I'll just call the Gen X again.

Reviews.Title: “OK I guess, but probably wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Memphis for 3 nights with my partner, on our extended trip around Europe & the USA. It was the end of the summer season but still exceptionally hot in Memphis. We did not have a car, but managed to make our way around many of the city attractions without too much trouble. We booked our accommodation via the hotel directly, & confirmed a place to stay for the duration of our holiday. On our arrival (via plane) we had to take a taxi to the hotel, as it was a Sunday & the airport bus doesnâ€™t run then (go figure). The hotel is fairly close to town (about 2 miles), but it isnâ€™t really in a very nice area â€“ there are a lot of parking lots & a few abandoned buildings around. There is not much to do around the hotel itself, although there are a few fast food restaurants & a Walgreens about 5 or so minutes walk away. There is a hotel car park, which offers one or two parks per room. We were checked in by a young Indian gentleman who was incredibly slow at serving us â€“ considering we had already paid for the room in advance, the 30 minutes it took to be checked in was a bit much really. There are two lifts (although only one was working when we were there), which would help any older guests that might wish to stay. We were given room 506, which was quite nice & fairly spacious â€“ we had a king-sized bed, a small fridge, flat screen TV (with several channels but no Sky/cable), DVD player, ipod docking station, desk & chair, sofa chair, wardrobe & private bathroom â€“ everything was new & in really good condition, & the shower was hot with OK water pressure. Our room was very tidy, but we did spot a cockroach in our bed at one point!! We ventured downstairs & asked about the internet, as I had a lot of work to do online, but the guy who checked us in said he didnâ€™t know anything about the internet, so we were unable to use it (if it was even available at all). He seemed more interested in talking about the football that he was watching on TV than about helping us. We then asked him how to get into town so that we could urgently go to an internet cafe, & he told us where to catch the trolley from (the stop is a few minutes walk away) â€“ we had heard him assure another patron earlier that the trolley would be running, despite being a Sunday evening. When we reached the trolley stop, the same guy we had seen earlier was still waiting for a trolley (for over an hour), & after 40 minutes waiting ourselves, we all gave up & went back to the hotel (it turns out that the trolley doesnâ€™t run after 6pm on Sunday nights). We were tired & frustrated by this point, & when we returned we noticed that the same desk clerk had a bunch of his friends over, & they were all eating pizza & taking up the chairs & couches in the lobby. Some other guests arrived & asked if there was free pizza, but the boys just made fun of them (because obviously the pizza wasnâ€™t free, or for guests). It was incredibly unprofessional & uncomfortable. The next morning breakfast was provided â€“ it mostly consisted of packet pastries & coffee, although there was a little bit of variety. Breakfast was served in the lobby & there were only about four tables there, so if you are in a large group then this may not be suitable. Despite the lack of space in the breakfast area, this hotel would suit people of all types, including older visitors or large groups. However, you will need to have a car if you wish to access Memphis easily or if you donâ€™t want to walk around the area at night (I definitely wouldnâ€™t do it alone). The hotelâ€™s website seems to claim quite a few things that arenâ€™t true, so just be careful â€“ there was no free bottled water available (that we could see â€“ there were bottles for $1 in the lobby though). There was also no internet access (maybe there is, but we couldnâ€™t get any), & no â€˜healthyâ€™ breakfast (unless you consider the 1 apple & 4 bananas available at breakfast to constitute being healthy). In the evening when we returned to the hotel, family of the employees were gathered in the lobby watching TV on the couches, & there was nowhere to sit. It was all a little weird for us. All in all, if you are after a fairly clean, spacious hotel & donâ€™t care about the neighbourhood, the service, internet access or breakfast, then you might find this hotel OK. If we are ever back in the Memphis area then we would consider returning here for comfortâ€™s sake, but not for any other reason. Thanks for an OK stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Gen X”
Reviews.Author: fftatum
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, The concept is wonderful. It's art deco appearance really works. It is modern with a friendly staff. Just minutes from downtown, the trolley took us everywhere we needed to go. I will be back and recommend it to anyone coming to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Stay At Your Own Risk!”
Reviews.Author: Del_1972
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Gen X Inn on Madison Ave. Tuesday July 29th, 2008 and had planned on staying a total of seven nights. On the morning of Friday August 1st, we found that our vehicle had been broken into. The driver's door window was shattered, the interior covered in broken glass and the contents ransacked. My stereo receiver / CD player and mounting kit was stolen along with a digital camera from the glovebox and a small amount of cash that I had hidden in the ashtray, mostly in coins. There was a fair amount of incidental damage caused by the broken glass as well as the items being removed from our vehicle. I had my door glass replaced so that I could drive home. That was $245, of which I paid $100 deductible and my insurance company paid the rest. My glass was tinted whereas this is clear and I'll probably have to pay that expense out of pocket. The contents that were stolen are covered under my home owner's policy which means filing a separate claim and paying another $100 deductible. Memphis Police responded within ten minutes of being called (there is a precinct one street over on Union). In all, three officers arrived on the scene, including a sargent and a lieutenant. I have absolutely nothing but praise for the Memphis Police Dept, as all three officers were extremely helpful and did far more than I expected of them. As for the Gen X Inn, they have been made aware of existing security issues as this is not the first case of guests having their vehicles robbed (see previous reviews). There is no security guard on premises, the cameras are few and not monitored as they should be and there is no fence around the parking lot to keep out intruders. That area of Memphis has a large population of homeless people, several of whom wandered in and around the hotel lot while we were there. The hotel owners never offered to reimburse us for our loss or to comp our stay. Fortunately Hotels.com did refund the remainder of our reservation without any penalty. The rooms themselves weren't bad and if not for the security issues and location, I would probably have given a better review. However, I cannot in good conscience recommend that anyone stay at the Gen X Inn due to the lack of security, especially if you're planning to park there overnight. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bass_roadie
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my way through Memphis. It was a great price. The rooms are very nice and large with great amenities. The internet connection was super fast! I took the streetcar downtown and had no problems. On the way home it was raining hard, so the streetcar driver dropped me off right front of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good deal close to downtown. The streetcar were great and took you everywhere you needed to go. I recommend buying the all day pass. The staff was nice, but not real helpful. They were college student with their heads in books all the time.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I found it!”
Reviews.Author: mpeebles910
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of Gen X Inn, but I wanted to stay in Mid-Town Memphis without paying an arm and a leg since my sole purpose in the visit was to see my best friend and her week-old baby. I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms were extremely clean and very nice ... marble countertops, large bathtub with great shower head, flat-screen TV mounted on the wall and very cold air!! This was my 1-year-old son's first hotel stay and he loved it. The lobby was very clean as well and had lots of drinks and snacks. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. Room service did a fantastic job and if I go back to Memphis in the near future, I'll stay there again. Great location, great price and more bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: msdiva2u
Reviews.Content: we had no other choice, everything was booked up at the time, because it was Memphis in May weekend, I know the price went double, but its ok for a short visit

Reviews.Title: “warning”
Reviews.Author: zymar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had reservations for 2 nights at the Gen X Inn April 11 and 12 2008. The rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished. The inn is located in a extreme poverty/homeless area of memphis. There was no physical security on the premises while we were there. Our first night was fine but as we were leaving the hotel saturday to attend a meeting we noticed the vehicle next to ours had its windshield shattered. The owner was inspecting it and stated that all his belongings had been stolen from his vehicle. It over an hour for memphis police department to respond to his call. Upon inspection of my truck, I discovered that the lock on my door had been bashed in. fortunately I had all my valuables in the room. After some discussion we decided this place was not safe enough for us and checked out., still being charged for the exta night . We made out safety concerns known to the desk clerk. She stated "We have security cameras and not to worry". This would be a good place to stay if this place had a security staff present.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: lilmowa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The secretary was not very congenial. I booked my trip on Orbitz. As you may know when you book your trip with them they take payment when you book. After I booked I called the hotel because I would be checking in very late and wanted to make the staff aware. I spoke to the front desk operator and she said that there would be no problem. I asked if there was anything else I needed to do and she pulled up my Orbitz reservation. She said no and that everything was paid for and all I needed to do was check in. When I got to the hotel The secretary asked for the card I reserved the room with. I gave it to her and she said she needed to swipe the card for there records. Turns out she was actually charging a 100.00 charge to my card. When I asked her what she was doing she said it was just a deposit and I would get it back in 7-10 days. When I asked her why wasn't I told before hand she said that it is just how we do it here. I told her I did not want her to charge my card and she said that she had to or I could not stay and I would lose my reservation payment. I got very upset and she said that I could give her cash and it would be returned the next morning, but only after the room had been inspected. That I should make sure I check out earlier if I wanted it back. I think that it is horrible to hold someones credit card or bank account or cash hostage for a room. Beware of hidden costs.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place”
Reviews.Author: southerntravelin
Reviews.Content: First of all, the lady at the front desk was very nice and quite helpful. The rooms are clean and very nice. They took the time to add very nice details. This hotel has a very New York City hotel vibe to it- very cool!!! I read some of the other reviews, and I really never thought of this hotel as being noisy; however, I did stay on a Sunday night. While it's not on Beale St., you are only a $6 cab ride away. Just a few hints for tourists- skip Rendezvous Ribs- always a huge line and very pricy. Instead, check out Central Ave. Ribs. This is where the locals go. It's not decorated really fancy, but the food is GREAT- Ribs for two with four sides for only $20. Also, for breakfast- check out a little mom and pop dinner called Barksdale. It's not health food, but it is the BEST southern style breakfast you can find. For good music, check out the Rum Boogie Cafe on Beale St. It's authentic blues music. Even if you skip all of this, the hotel is still worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: skittles78
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Gen X hotel. Extremely easy to find as we were from out of town. Very clean and comfortable. Rooms were a little noisy but overall quiet at night. We did not have breakfast in the morning nor did we want the housekeepers rifleing through our belongings. Just a presonal preference. Location was great! Only minutes from Downtown Beale st. and a $7.00 Cab fair to Rendezvous Ribs on South 2nd St. Best BBQ ribs in Memphis. I would suggest that any elderly folks spend the extra $100 to stay somewhere like the peabody. Nice hotel for the younger crowd!

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel, but poor receptionist”
Reviews.Author: john063
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in October 07 and having arrived in Memphis in the morning we drove around town and went to the hotel at 12 pm and asked if it was possible to come in early. The receptionist stated firmly no, it has to be at 3 oclock, there was no inference such as sorry but they are doing the rooms, or come back in an hour. Consequently we drove around for a couple of hours and went back to the hotel with about half an hour to go and waited in the tables in the lobby. Not long after the receptionist send a subordinate over to say that we can go in if we like. We declined as she did not have the courtesy to come herself. Upon settling and in seeing her again we asked if she knows where the nearest internet cafe is and she stated that she did not know. We luckily stumbled on to the cafe oposit Sun Studios being about 2 minute drive from there. However, luckily our bad experience stopped with the receptionist. The room was clean and comfortable, they have cabkle tv with a plasma tv. The location is good in that you have the cable car right in front however we had a hire car and did not use it. The breakfast was great for the morning start offering fruit, a variety of cereals and youghurts. The staff assisting there as well as the other receptionist immediately responded to any requests, such as more milk, youghurt, muffins etc Overall we enjpyed our stay bar the attitude of the receptionist. I can't understand why hotels employ unfriendly, disinterested and poor ambassodors for both the hotel and the city to this positions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jr1082
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gen X Inn because of it's close proximity to the Southern College of Optometry. The building has been recently remodeled and is very clean. The room smelled a little of bleach, but I liked that I knew it was clean. The rooms are very large, well lit, and have a great air conditioner. We visited around the end of September and this was very nice to have. As was the mini fridge. The bed was very comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. The shower was great with a large shower head that was like standing under a waterfall. The desk chair was very comfortable. There have been a few complaints about under staffing. We did not have any problems with the staff. The person at the desk was always helpful and very polite. The hotel's location is very convenient if you have a car. It is only 5 minutes from Mud Island Park, Beale Street, or the Memphis Zoo, and a couple of minutes to the BBQ shop, a great place to get some BBQ! Overall, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: Something2say
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed. I had noticed the hotel during my trips to Memphis and decided to book a stay. When I got to my room it was not the picture from the website. I was told that the King room has the bright, vibrant colors and updated look. There was an upright ironing board sitting in the middle of the room without an iron. Odd. Not a bad hotel, but really not as exciting as I had envisioned.

Reviews.Title: “Success!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spleakie
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Memphis with my 7 siblings, who careers ranged from business owners to an exective vice president of a bank, booking this unknown hotel was the scariest thing I had ever done. My siblings are pretty five star when it come to their regular travel, so I was really nervous about some of the other reviews I read because I just knew I was with an even pickier crowd. However, when we got to this hotel, we found the decor to be very pleasent and comfortable. The process of checking in was really smooth. The rooms were HUGE! Like many hotels, you don't have a lot of room to walk around but that was not the case with this hotelroom. The bathroom was great with a wonderful waterfall shower. I actually heard my brother(exc.VP) say that the Gen X Inn was more comfortable then many other 5 stars he had been in. The bed was so wonderful and cozy. There was a plasma screen tv in the room that made all the difference in the experience. Since we reside near downtown Chicago, the neighborhood near the Gen X was actually "quiet and safe" to us. I thought I would be angry that Beale street was 2 miles away but that was actually better because we drove and it was a straight shot to the action , with no crazy traffic to have to listen to all night long. My only small problem with the hotel was the continential breakfest. It really was continential! Packaged donuts, fruit and boxed cereal. The kids would love it adults will be pretty hungry. However, the coffee was GREAT! If this hotel could add a breakfest like other 2 star hotels, it would have been a five state experience. Nevertheless, it was great and I will definately stay here again. So would the rest of my family.

Reviews.Title: “decent, but a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: drbmbay
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several medium priced hotels in the downtown Memphis area and by far the comfort inn is my favorite, and further midtown is the french quarter, but I wound up this time here and it wasn't so bad. the rooms were pretty big and though it's trying to be a "boutique" hotel (and please ask them to change the name to something less silly) it's not really hip and trendy. it's nice they have plasma screens and dvd players (but no dvd library), I also found no wireless but ethernet plug in which was fine. the beds were big and cumfy. and no complaints about the cleanliness. yes, you are about two blocks from trolly station, but it's memphis and you'll wait a lot longer than you want to for the thing, so better off get a rentacar. parking is nothing or cheap in memphis for the most part. if you're looking to spend your time drinking on beale street, stay more walking distance to downtown, but for access to both downtown and midtown, it's not a bad choice. nothing special, nothing to complain about. they could knock the room price down by a little.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel..but, a few things you should know!”
Reviews.Author: jjsmom1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the middle of May, during "Memphis in May". The hotel was a little hard to find. There wasn't a large sign; I only recognized the hotel from the picture I saw online. We got there a few hours early and were charged $25 to check-in early. Boo! The manager was very nice. The building is pretty weird (I think it was an old apartment building). The decor is interesting but for being "Gen X" there was no wireless internet in the hotel. There was a plasma in the room but only cable hookup for internet. I was a bit concerned about the neighborhood. The trolley station is about 2 CITY blocks away from the hotel. The neighborhood was a bit scary especially late at night, but Memphis is a tourist town, right? Don't be fooled by the continental breakfast. It was an Otis Spunkmeyer muffin, coffee, and orange juice in a styrofoam cup. My husband paid $1 for a can of soda and $1 for a bottled OJ in the morning. I wasn't too impressed but I would stay there again. I will however try another hotel the next time I'm in Memphis. Don't try and check-in early!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MiBird
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for it's location and price. We were right next to the highway and just minutes from downtown. The woman at the front desk was extremely nice and even printed us off directions for our designation for that first evening. The room and bathroom were clean. Everything was very appealing and attractive in this hotel. Only complaints I had: the coffee cups in our room would not fit under the coffee maker in our room, so I had to go downstairs for a cup of coffee; We did not have any hangers and they were unable to supply us with more, since they were stolen from the previous people in the room; The room was quite noisy - we could hear loud clunking of shoes in the hallway and neighbors using hair dryers. All in all it was a great stay. We will probably stay at Gen X next time we visit Memphis.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Gen X Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1177 Madison Avenue, Memphis, TN 38104-2202
